articles.title: Why Design Systems Matter
articles.subtitle: How investing in design systems saves time, reduces inconsistency, and scales your product team effectively.
articles.author: Lucas Sublime

content.text: Design systems have become essential infrastructure for modern product teams. They're not just style guides or component librariesâ€”they're the foundation that enables teams to move fast without breaking things.
What Makes a Good Design System
A good design system balances flexibility with consistency. It provides clear guidelines while leaving room for creativity and evolution.
Every design system needs these foundational elements: typography scales, color tokens, spacing units, and reusable components.
Design systems are about enabling teams to make better decisions faster, not restricting creativity.
Beyond the design benefits, systems deliver measurable business value: faster shipping, reduced technical debt, and improved team efficiency.

articles.title: Building Component Libraries That Scale
articles.subtitle: Practical strategies for creating component libraries that grow with your product and team.
articles.author: Lucas Sublime

content.text: Component libraries are the practical implementation of your design system. Here's how to build ones that actually get used.
Begin with the components you use most frequently. Don't try to build everything at once.
